Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=0.4 µM)&(MBC=1.5 µM), Bacillus megaterium (MIC=0.8 µM)&(MBC=1.5 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=0.6 µM)&(MBC=1.2 µM), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=3.1 µM)&(MBC=6.2 µM), Enterococcus fecalis (MIC=0.6 µM)&(MBC=1.2 µM), Aerococcus viridans (MIC=0.4 µM)&(MBC=1.5 µM);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D31 (MIC=1.2 µM)&(MBC=1.2 µM), E. coli 363 (MIC=1.2 µM)&(MBC=1.2 µM), Salmonella newport (MIC>100 µM)&(MBC>100 µM), Vibrio alginolyticus (MIC=50 µM)&(MBC>100 µM), Vibrio harveyi (MIC=50 µM)&(MBC=100 µM), Vibrio metshnikovii (MIC>100 µM)&(MBC>100 µM).NOTE:MIC=minimal inhibitory concentration; MBC = minimal bactericidal concentration.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The three-dimensional solution structure of MGD-1 has been established using (1)H NMR and mainly consists of a helical part (Asn7-Ser16) and two antiparallel beta-strands (Arg20-Cys25 and Cys33-Arg37), together giving rise to the common cystine-stabilized alpha-beta motif frequently observed in scorpion toxins. In MGD-1, the cystine-stabilized alpha-beta motif is stabilized by four disulfide bonds (Cys4-Cys25, Cys10-Cys33, Cys14-Cys35,
Sequence Information.Function: Active against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria but is not cytotoxic towards human erythrocytes or protozoa.
Sequence Information.Transgenic plants: expression of this peptide in tobacco improves resistance to pathogens.

Literature.Title: Mussel defensins are synthesised and processed in granulocytes then released into the plasma after bacterial challenge.
Literature.Author: Mitta G, Vandenbulcke F, Hubert F, Roch P.

Literature.Title: A member of the arthropod defensin family from edible Mediterranean mussels (Mytilus galloprovincialis).
Literature.Author: Hubert F, Noeel T, Roch P.

Literature.Title: Solution structure and activity of the synthetic four-disulfide bond Mediterranean mussel defensin (MGD-1).
Literature.Author: Yang YS, Mitta G, Chavanieu A, Calas B, Sanchez JF, Roch P, Aumelas A.
